intro: Brassica odorata, commonly known as the Chinese mustard or Chinese cabbage, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellow, cruciform flowers. Its fruit is a siliqua, which contains several seeds. Brassica odorata is cultivated for its edible leaves and stems, and it is used in various traditional cuisines.
